/about/features/ ======= Abouts on Linux PTP Project https://linuxptp.nwtime.org/about/ Recent content in Abouts on Linux PTP Project Hugo -- gohugo.io
Features https://linuxptp.nwtime.org/about/features/ Mon, 01 Jan 0001 00:00:00 +0000
https://linuxptp.nwtime.org/about/features/ >>>>>>> 3fe3818d71500cced792b027cbf74ebc3e8b73ad Features Supports hardware and software time stamping via the Linux SO_TIMESTAMPING socket option. Supports the Linux PTP Hardware Clock (PHC) subsystem by using the clock_gettime family of calls, including the clock_adjtimex system call. Implements Boundary Clock (BC), Ordinary Clock (OC) and Transparent Clock (TC). Transport over UDP/IPv4, UDP/IPv6, and raw Ethernet (Layer 2). Supports IEEE 802.1AS-2011 in the role of end station.

/about/thanks/ ======= https://linuxptp.nwtime.org/about/thanks/ Mon, 01 Jan 0001 00:00:00 +0000
https://linuxptp.nwtime.org/about/thanks/ >>>>>>> 3fe3818d71500cced792b027cbf74ebc3e8b73ad Thanks Thanks to AudioScience Inc. for sponsoring the IEEE 8021.AS support. Thanks to Exablaze for donating an ExaNIC X10 (now known as Cisco Nexus SmartNIC). Thanks to Intel Corporation for donating four Intel Ethernet NICs: the 82574, 82580, 82599, and the i210. Thanks to Meinberg Funkuhren for donating a LANTIME M1000. Thanks to Moser Baer for sponsoring the Telecom Profiles and unicast support. For testing I use an OTMC 100 grandmaster clock donated by OMICRON Lab.
